item.title: After Syria’s 14-Year Civil War, a Search for Victims Leads to Mass Graves
item.description: More than 100,000 people disappeared during the 13-year civil war. To bring closure to some of their families, the new government faces the challenging task of exhuming remains from scores of burial sites.
item.dc:creator: Raja Abdulrahim
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.media:credit: Emile Ducke for The New York Times
item.media:description: A trench at the Najha cemetery near Damascus, Syria. The area is believed to hold a mass grave.

item.title: At Saudi Behest, Trump Vows to Seek Peace in Sudan, a Goal He Had Spurned
item.description: It is unclear what President Trump will do to end a brutal civil war in which both sides are backed by U.S. allies, but his statement that he will try has raised hopes for peace.
item.dc:creator: Declan Walsh and Vivian Nereim
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.media:credit: Ivor Prickett for The New York Times
item.media:description: After the Sudanese military retook part of Khartoum from the Rapid Support Forces, the military section capital’s airport in was strewed with plane wreckage in March.

item.title: Iran Withdraws From Deal for International Nuclear Inspections
item.description: Iran’s foreign minister said his country would halt plans for a reinstatement of nuclear inspections at a time of heightened concern over Iran’s enriched uranium.
item.dc:creator: Erika Solomon
item.media:description: The Natanz Enrichment Facility in Iran after American airstrikes struck it in June. A U.N. nuclear watchdog agency has been unable to inspect the country’s nuclear facilities.

item.title: Trump Meeting With Saudi Prince Showcased Prince’s Makeover, and America’s
item.description: Mohammed bin Salman was briefly a global pariah after the killing of a Saudi dissident. But he has rebuilt his image as a deal-maker and influential investor.
item.dc:creator: Vivian Nereim and Ismaeel Naar
item.media:description: President Trump welcomed Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia to the White House on Tuesday.

item.title: Ambassador Huckabee Held Meeting With Jonathan Pollard, Ex-Spy, at U.S. Embassy in Israel
item.description: Jonathan J. Pollard, who was convicted of espionage, said in an interview that the meeting, which was highly unusual for a U.S. diplomat to attend, had been friendly.
item.dc:creator: Natan Odenheimer and Adam Rasgon
item.media:description: Jonathan J. Pollard leaving federal court in New York in 2015. In a phone interview with The New York Times, he said he did not regret spying for Israel.

item.title: Family Affair: Commerce Secretary’s Sons Cash In on A.I. Frenzy
item.description: Howard Lutnick is helping push data center projects. His family companies are profiting from them.
item.dc:creator: Eric Lipton, Michael Rothfeld, David Yaffe-Bellany and Ana Swanson
item.media:credit: Paul Ratje for The New York Times
item.media:description: A mammoth data center is rising in Amarillo, Texas. Firms controlled by the Lutnick family have helped finance it, banking millions in fees in the process.

item.title: Israeli Strikes Kill at Least 25 in Gaza Amid Cease-Fire, Officials Say
item.description: Israel’s military said it had launched attacks across Gaza after Palestinian militants shot at its troops. The six-week-old cease-fire has been pierced periodically by bursts of violence.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Boxerman
item.media:description: Israeli soldiers and tanks gathered near the Gaza border in southern Israel on Monday.

item.title: Family Who Died While Visiting Istanbul May Have Been Poisoned, Authorities Say
item.description: Investigators are examining whether the family of four from Germany, including two children, died from exposure to a toxic chemical found in their hotel room.
item.dc:creator: Safak Timur and Jonathan Wolfe
item.media:description: The owner of the Harbour Suites Old City Hotel in Istanbul and two employees were among 11 people who were detained after the deaths this month of four family members who were staying there, officials said.

item.title: Iran Releases Tanker It Seized From the Strait of Hormuz
item.description: The ship had lost contact with its managers while traveling near Iran on its way to Singapore last week. All 21 members of the crew are safe.
item.dc:creator: Pranav Baskar
item.media:description: A quarter of the world’s oil passes through the Strait of Hormuz, where Iran seized a tanker on Friday.

item.title: Trump Lauds M.B.S. During White House Visit and Dismisses Khashoggi’s Killing
item.description: President Trump rejected a U.S. intelligence report finding that Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman had ordered the murder of a journalist.
item.dc:creator: Katie Rogers
item.media:description: President Trump and Mohammed bin Salman, the crown prince and prime minister of Saudi Arabia, in the Oval Office on Tuesday.

item.title: Here’s Who’s Attending Trump’s Dinner for the Saudi Crown Prince: Elon Musk, Cristiano Ronaldo and more.
item.description: Here are some of the notable guests invited to President Trump’s dinner for Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump at a dinner on Tuesday during the Saudi crown prince’s visit to Washington.

item.title: Israeli Airstrike on Refugee Camp in Lebanon Kills at Least 13, Officials Say
item.description: It was one of the deadliest Israeli strikes on Lebanon since a cease-fire with Hezbollah went into effect about a year ago.
item.dc:creator: Euan Ward and Ephrat Livni
item.media:description: Members of the Lebanese Army gathered on Tuesday at the entrance of the Ain al-Hilweh refugee camp after an Israeli strike.

item.title: The Saudi crown prince receives an especially warm welcome at the White House.
item.dc:creator: Vivian Nereim
item.media:description: President Trump lavished praise on Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia during his visit to the White House on Tuesday.

item.title: Khashoggi’s widow wants the U.S. to pressure Saudi Arabia to return his remains.
item.description: James Khashoggi, U.
item.dc:creator: Ephrat Livni
item.media:description: Jamal and Hanan Elatr Khashoggi were married in 2018, a few months before Jamal was killed in Istanbul.

item.title: ‘Things Happen’: Trump Brushes Off the Murder of Khashoggi
item.description: A reporter asked Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman about the murder of the Washington Post columnist Jamal Khashoggi. President Trump interjected.
item.dc:creator: Shawn McCreesh
item.media:description: President Trump responds to a reporter’s question about the murder of the Washington Post columnist Jamal Khashoggi on Tuesday.

item.title: Trump wants a Saudi-Israel deal, but that’s not likely soon.
item.dc:creator: Ismaeel Naar
item.media:description: President Trump in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, this year. Mr. Trump has continued to argue that a diplomatic breakthrough is within reach.

item.title: For the Saudi crown prince, international criticism over the killing of Jamal Khashoggi has faded.
item.dc:creator: Vivian Nereim
item.media:description: Jamal Khashoggi in Manama, Bahrain, in 2014.

item.title: Trump Family’s Business Ties to Saudi Arabia Raise Ethics Worries
item.description: President Trump will host Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, Saudi Arabia’s de facto ruler, who oversees a major construction project that is in talks with the Trump family business.
item.dc:creator: Vivian Nereim
item.media:description: President Trump, Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman and Jerry Inzerillo at a model of the proposed Diriyah development during a state dinner in Saudi Arabia in May.

item.title: UN Support Propels Trump Gaza Plan, but Road Ahead Is Still Rough
item.description: The Security Council’s backing offered a scaffolding of international legitimacy that will be needed to persuade countries to help see the plans through.
item.dc:creator: David M. Halbfinger
item.media:credit: Saher Alghorra for The New York Times
item.media:description: In Gaza City on Saturday.

item.title: Here’s the latest.
item.description: The president is offering the crown prince fighter jets, a nuclear agreement and other deals as part of his efforts to collect investment and push forward on Middle East peace.
item.dc:creator: Katie Rogers and Vivian Nereim
item.category: Dar Al Arkan Real Estate Development Co

item.title: Palestinian Voices Absent from U.S.-Run Center Planning Gaza’s Future
item.description: U.S. and Israeli soldiers, foreign diplomats and aid workers are congregated in a warehouse in Israel to talk about the future of Gaza. One key group is missing: Palestinians.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Boxerman, Adam Rasgon, Natan Odenheimer and David M. Halbfinger
item.media:description: U.S. military personnel and other officials monitor screens displaying imagery of the Gaza Strip during a media tour of the new Civil-Military Coordination Center in Kiryat Gat, Israel, on Monday.

item.title: After Hundreds of Gazans Arrive on Mystery Flights, South Africa Asks How
item.description: A little-known group sold passage to desperate Palestinians who didn’t know their destination, catching the South African government by surprise.
item.dc:creator: John Eligon and Zimasa Matiwane
item.media:description: A Palestinian man, one of those granted entry to South Africa, with his child at an undisclosed location in Johannesburg, on Friday.

item.title: U.N. Security Council Adopts Trump’s Peace Plan for Gaza
item.description: Russia and China abstained in the vote, which provides a legal mandate for the Trump administration’s vision of how to move past the cease-fire to rebuild the war-ravaged enclave after two years of war.
item.dc:creator: Farnaz Fassihi
item.media:credit: Dave Sanders for The New York Times
item.media:description: The American resolution passed in the U.N. Security Council on Monday with 13 votes in favor.

item.title: Trump Says U.S. Will Sell F-35s to Saudis, Despite Pentagon Concerns
item.description: The president told reporters in the Oval Office on Monday that he planned to sell the advanced fighter jets to Riyadh.
item.dc:creator: Karoun Demirjian
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:description: President Trump and Melania Trump, the first lady, watch an F-35 fighter jet during a demonstration off the coast of Norfolk, Va., last month.

item.title: Trump Project in Maldives Opens More Doors for Cryptocurrency Investors
item.description: The Trump Organization and its Middle East development partner have announced a project in the Maldives that marries two of the family’s most successful moneymaking enterprises.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca R. Ruiz and Eric Lipton
item.category: Dar Al Arkan Real Estate Development Co
item.media:description: Eric Trump, the executive vice president of the Trump Organization and the president’s son, looked over a real estate plan on another project involving the Dubai-based company Dar Global in Doha in April.

item.title: More Than 40 Indian Pilgrims Are Killed in Bus Crash in Saudi Arabia
item.description: The passengers, who were participating in the Umrah pilgrimage, were traveling between the two holiest cities in Islam, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Mpoke Bigg
item.media:description: Family members of the victims of a bus crash in Saudi Arabia mourned in Hyderabad, India, home to many of the passengers, on Monday.

item.title: Too Powerful to Ignore, Saudi Prince Returns to Washington’s Embrace
item.description: Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman is to visit the White House on Tuesday for the first time since 2018, when the killing of a journalist by Saudi agents made him a pariah.
item.dc:creator: Vivian Nereim and Ismaeel Naar
item.media:description: President Trump and Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia in Riyadh, the capital, in May in Mr. Trump’s first major trip abroad of his second term.

item.title: Displaced Gazans Face More Misery as Torrential Rain Lashes Enclave
item.description: Heavy rainfall and chilling winds have added to the challenges facing people still forced to live in tents in the devastated territory.
item.dc:creator: Bilal Shbair, Abu Bakr Bashir and Aaron Boxerman
item.media:credit: Saher Alghorra for The New York Times
item.media:description: A flooded tent in Gaza City on Friday. After more than two years of war, many Palestinians are still living in camps without access to running water or electricity.

item.title: Dar Global Is the Trump Organization’s Key Foreign Partner
item.description: Dar Global bet big on the Trump name. It is now an essential foreign partner for the Trump Organization.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca R. Ruiz and Vivian Nereim
item.category: Dar Al Arkan Real Estate Development Co
item.media:description: A model of a proposed development to be built in Qatar by a partnership including the Trump Organization and Dar Global.

item.title: Trump Organization Is Said to Be in Talks on a Saudi Government Real Estate Deal
item.description: The chief executive of a Saudi firm says a Trump-branded project is “just a matter of time.” The Trump Organization’s major foreign partner is also signaling new Saudi deals.
item.dc:creator: Vivian Nereim and Rebecca R. Ruiz
item.category: Dar Al Arkan Real Estate Development Co
item.media:description: President Trump, Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman and Jerry Inzerillo at a model of the proposed Diriyah development during a state dinner in Saudi Arabia in May.

item.title: Fears Fuel Tanker Was Seized by Iran in Strait of Hormuz
item.description: The ship, which was flying a Marshall Islands flag, was passing through the Strait of Hormuz when it lost contact with its managers.
item.dc:creator: Pranav Baskar and Lynsey Chutel
item.media:description: The Strait of Hormuz has become a source of geopolitical tension.

item.title: At U.N. Security Council, Russia Counters Trump Gaza Plan With Its Own
item.description: The Trump administration wants the Security Council to adopt a resolution that has the 20-point U.S. plan annexed, effectively making it international law.
item.dc:creator: Farnaz Fassihi
item.media:credit: Saher Alghorra for The New York Times
item.media:description: Gaza City on Friday. The United States wants the U.N. Security Council to adopt a resolution that has the 20-point American plan annexed.

item.title: U.S. Envoy Said to Be Planning to Meet With Senior Hamas Official
item.description: An in-person encounter between Steve Witkoff and Khalil al-Hayya would signal the Trump administration’s interest in keeping a direct line of communication with the group.
item.dc:creator: Adam Rasgon, Natan Odenheimer, Luke Broadwater and Abu Bakr Bashir
item.media:credit: Nathan Howard for The New York Times
item.media:description: Steve Witkoff, the U.S. special envoy for peace missions, speaking at a military briefing in Israel last month.

item.title: Israeli Settler Attack During West Bank Olive Harvest Leads to Death of a Boy
item.description: Palestinians see the violence, and its tolerance by right-wing Israeli officialdom, as part of a broader campaign to harass them and make life so unbearable that they will abandon their villages.
item.dc:creator: David M. Halbfinger
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.media:credit: Afif Amireh for The New York Times
item.media:description: Relatives of Ayssam Ma’ala, who died after being tear gassed by soldiers, visited his grave in the West Bank town of Beita on Wednesday.
